cards.name: Clefable
cards.text: With its acute hearing, it can pick up sounds from far away. It usually hides in quiet places.

attacks.name: Fairy Power
attacks.text: Return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it in your hand.

cards.name: Deoxys
cards.text: DNA from a space virus mutated and became a Pokémon. It appears where auroras are seen.

attacks.name: Cell Storm
attacks.text: Discard 2 Psychic Energy attached to Deoxys and remove 6 damage counters from Deoxys.

cards.name: Dialga
cards.text: This Pokémon completely controls the flow of time. It uses its power to travel at will through the past and future.

attacks.name: Time Rewind
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck.

cards.name: Espeon
cards.text: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy's actions.

attacks.name: Solar Suggestion
attacks.text: Move up to 4 damage counters from any of your Pokémon to any of your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Forretress
cards.text: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside this shell is a total mystery.

attacks.name: Mirror Shot
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Everyone Explode Now
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of Pineco and Forretress you have in play. This attack does 30 damage to each of your Pineco and Forretress in play.

cards.name: Groudon
cards.text: Said to have expanded the lands by evaporating water with raging heat. It battled titanically with Kyogre.

attacks.name: Volcano Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard the top 4 cards of your opponent's deck. If tails, discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

cards.name: Gyarados
cards.text: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Hitmontop
cards.text: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.

attacks.name: Triple Kick
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Close Combat
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Hitmontop by attacks is increased by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Ho-Oh
cards.text: Legends claim this Pokémon flies the world's skies continuously on its magnificent seven-colored wings.

attacks.name: Scorching Wing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Fire Energy attached to Ho-Oh.

cards.name: Houndoom
cards.text: Upon hearing its eerie howls, other Pokémon get the shivers and head straight back to their nests.

attacks.name: Fire Counterattack
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Fighting Pokémon in play, this attack does 20 damage plus 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Dark Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Jirachi

abilities.name: Stardust Song
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Jirachi from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip 3 coins. For each heads, search your discard pile for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to Jirachi.

cards.text: Generations have believed that any wish written on a note on its head will come true when it awakens.

attacks.name: Time Hollow
attacks.text: Choose a number of your opponent's Stage 1 or Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon up to the amount of Energy attached to Jirachi. Remove the highest Stage Evolution card from each of those Pokémon and put those cards back into your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Kyogre
cards.text: A mythical Pokémon said to have swelled the seas with rain and tidal waves. It battled with Groudon.

attacks.name: Destructive Tsunami
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 40 damage to each of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Leafeon
cards.text: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, you'll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.

attacks.name: Miasma Wind
attacks.text: Does 50 damage times the number of Special Conditions affecting the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sooting Scent
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Lucario
cards.text: It's said that no foe can remain invisible to Lucario, since it can detect auras. Even foes it could not otherwise see.

attacks.name: Dimension Sphere
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each of your Pokémon in the Lost Zone.

attacks.name: Sky Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Lugia
cards.text: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Magmortar
cards.text: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.

attacks.name: Hard Crush
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards from your deck. This attack does 50 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

attacks.name: Mantle Bazooka
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Magmortar.

cards.name: Ninetales

abilities.name: Roast Reveal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards. This power can't be used if Ninetales is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Its nine beautiful tails are filled with a wondrous energy that could keep it alive for 1,000 years.

cards.name: Pachirisu

abilities.name: Self-Generation
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Pachirisu from your hand onto your Bench, you may attach up to 2 Lightning Energy cards from your hand to Pachirisu.

cards.text: It's one of the kinds of Pokémon with electric cheek pouches. It shoots charges from its tail.

attacks.name: Shocking Bolt
attacks.text: Put all Energy cards attached to Pachirisu in the Lost Zone.

cards.name: Palkia
cards.text: Its total control over the boundaries of space enable it to transport itself to faraway places or even other dimensions.

attacks.name: Wormhole
attacks.text: Switch Palkia with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Rayquaza
cards.text: It flies in the ozone layer, way up high in the sky. Until recently, no one had ever seen it.

attacks.name: Inferno Spear
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy and a Lightning Energy attached to Rayquaza.

cards.name: Smeargle

abilities.name: Portrait
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Smeargle is your Active Pokémon, you may look at your opponent's hand. If you do, choose a Supporter card you find there and use the effect of that card as the effect of this power. This power can't be used if Smeargle is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Once it becomes an adult, it has a tendency to let its comrades plant footprints on its back.

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Umbreon
cards.text: When agitated, this Pokémon protects itself by spraying poisonous sweat from its pores.

attacks.name: Moonlight Fang
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects, including damage, done to Umbreon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon than has any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

cards.name: Ampharos
cards.text: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.

attacks.name: Acceleration Bolt
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Ampharos does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Cleffa

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Cleffa is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Cleffa by attacks.

cards.text: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

attacks.name: Eeeeeeek
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 6 cards. Cleffa is now Asleep.

cards.name: Feraligatr
cards.text: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.

attacks.name: Spinning Tail
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Granbull
cards.text: Because its fangs are too heavy, it always keeps its head tilted down. However, its bite is powerful.

attacks.name: Timid Tackle
attacks.text: Granbull does 20 damage to itself. Switch Granbull with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chomp
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Granbull.

cards.name: Meganium
cards.text: Meganium's breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Giant Bloom
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Meganium.

cards.name: Mismagius
cards.text: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.

attacks.name: Sleeping Spell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Trainer, Supporter, and Stadium cards in your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Mr. Mime

abilities.name: Trick Reveal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have both you and your opponent reveal your hands. This power can't be used if Mr. Mime is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Its fingertips emit a peculiar force field that hardens air to create an actual wall.

attacks.name: Juggling
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Pidgeot
cards.text: It spreads its beautiful wings wide to frighten its enemies. It can fly at Mach 2 speed.

attacks.name: Headwind
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the attack cost of each of the Defending Pokémon's attacks is ColorlessColorless more.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

cards.name: Skarmory
cards.text: After nesting in bramble bushes, the wings of its chicks grow hard from scratches by thorns.

attacks.name: Steel Coat
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Metal Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Slowking

abilities.name: Second Sight
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 3 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order. This power can't be used if Slowking is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: It has incredible intellect and intuition. Whatever the situation, it remains calm and collected.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Snorlax
cards.text: Its stomach's digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. It can even eat things off the ground.

attacks.name: Layabout
attacks.text: Remove all damage counters from Snorlax. Snorlax can't use Layabout during your next turn.

attacks.name: Clomp Clomp Clobber
attacks.text: Put 1 Energy card attached to Snorlax in the Lost Zone.

cards.name: Tangrowth
cards.text: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Energy attached to Tangrowth.

attacks.name: Plow Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, put 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon in the Lost Zone.

cards.name: Typhlosion
cards.text: It has a secret, devastating move. It rubs its blazing fur together to cause huge explosions.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Typhlosion.

cards.name: Tyrogue

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Tyrogue is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Tyrogue by attacks.

cards.text: Even though it is small, it can't be ignored because it will slug any handy target without warning.

attacks.name: Mischievous Punch
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. Tyrogue is now Asleep.

cards.name: Ursaring
cards.text: With its ability to distinguish any aroma, it unfailing finds all food buried deep underground.

attacks.name: Cross Chop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

cards.name: Weezing
cards.text: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Super Explosion
attacks.text: Weezing does 90 damage to itself, and don't apply Weakness to this damage.

cards.name: Zangoose
cards.text: Its fur would all stand on end if it smelled a Seviper nearby. Its sharp claws tear up its foes.

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Zangoose's Lost Claw attack's base damage is 80.

attacks.name: Lost Claw
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and put it in the Lost Zone.

cards.name: Bayleef
cards.text: A spicy aroma emanates from around its neck. The aroma acts as a stimulant to restore health.

cards.name: Croconaw
cards.text: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Donphan
cards.text: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its tackle is strong enough to knock down a house.

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Flaaffy
cards.text: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won't grow.

attacks.name: Thunder Spear
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Flareon
cards.text: It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal flame pouch, which heats it to over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Flareon.

cards.name: Jolteon
cards.text: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Jolteon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Magby

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Magby is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Magby by attacks.

cards.text: It is found in volcanic craters. Its body temperature is over 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit, so don't underestimate it.

attacks.name: Play with Fire
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned. Magby is now Asleep.

cards.name: Mime Jr.

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Mime Jr. is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Mime Jr. by attacks.

cards.text: In an attempt to confuse its enemy, it mimics the enemy's movements. Then it wastes no time in making itself scarce!

attacks.name: Sleepy Lost
attacks.text: Put the top card of your opponent's deck in the Lost Zone. Mime Jr. is now Asleep.

cards.name: Pidgeotto
cards.text: It renders its prey immobile using well-developed claws, then carries the prey more than 60 miles to its nest.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Quilava
cards.text: This Pokémon is fully covered by nonflammable fur. It can withstand any kind of fire attack.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Quilava.

cards.name: Riolu
cards.text: They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.

attacks.name: Tumble Over
attacks.text: Riolu can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Seviper
cards.text: In battle, it uses its bladed tail to counter any Zangoose. It secretes a deadly venom in its tail.

attacks.name: Poison Buildup
attacks.text: Seviper is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Poison Effect
attacks.text: If Seviper is Poisoned, this attack does 20 damage plus 60 more damage and remove the Special Condition Poisoned from Seviper.

cards.name: Vaporeon
cards.text: When Vaporeon's fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Vaporeon.

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Chikorita
cards.text: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up sunrays.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Chikorita.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: Chikorita does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.text: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn ,any damage done to Clefairy by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Cyndaquil
cards.text: It is timid, and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Cyndaquil.

cards.name: Eevee
cards.text: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.

cards.name: Hitmonchan
cards.text: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

attacks.name: Detect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Hitmonchan during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Sky Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Hitmonlee
cards.text: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.

cards.name: Houndour
cards.text: To corner prey, they check each other's location using barks that only they can understand.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

cards.name: Koffing
cards.text: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Magikarp
cards.text: For no reason, it jumps and splashes about, making it easy for predators like Pidgeotto to catch it mid-jump.

cards.name: Magmar
cards.text: It dislikes cold places, so it blows scorching flames to make the environment suitable for itself.

cards.name: Mareep
cards.text: Its fleece grows continually. In the summer, the fleece is fully shed, but it grows back in a week.

cards.name: Mawile
cards.text: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

attacks.name: Selfish Draw
attacks.text: Look at the top card of your deck. You may put it into your hand. If not, discard it and draw a card.

attacks.name: Destructive Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Misdreavus
cards.text: It loves to bite and yank people's hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.

attacks.name: Dual Draw
attacks.text: Each player draws 3 cards.

cards.name: Phanpy

abilities.name: Ultra-Thick Skin
abilities.text: As long as Phanpy has Energy attached to it, any damage done to Phanpy by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: As a sign of affection, it bumps with its snout. However, it is so strong, it may send you flying.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

cards.name: Pidgey
cards.text: Common in grassy areas and forests, it is very docile and will chase off enemies by flapping up sand.

attacks.name: Messenger
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle Pidgey and all cards attached to it back into your deck.

cards.name: Pineco
cards.text: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Pineco's Surprise Attack attack's base damage is 80.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Relicanth
cards.text: Discovered by chance during deep-sea explorations, it has not changed since ancient times.

attacks.name: Prehistoric Wisdom
attacks.text: Choose a card from your hand and put it in the Lost Zone. Then, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Granite Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Relicanth by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Slowpoke
cards.text: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.

attacks.name: Whismy Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Snubbull
cards.text: It has an active, playful nature. Many women like to frolic with it because of its affectionate ways.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Tangela
cards.text: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.

attacks.name: Nutritional Support
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Teddiursa
cards.text: If it finds honey, its crescent mark glows. It always licks its paws because they are soaked with honey.

attacks.name: Fake Tears
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn, and any damage done to Teddiursa by attack is reduced by 30 (after applying weakness and resistance).

cards.name: Totodile
cards.text: It is small but rough and tough. It won't hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.

attacks.name: Aqua Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to Totodile. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Vulpix
cards.text: If it is attacked by an enemy that is stronger than itself, it feigns injury to fool the enemy and escapes.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Vulpix.

cards.name: Cheerleader's Cheer
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Draw 3 cards. Your opponent may draw a card.

cards.name: Copycat
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Dual Ball
cards.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Interviewer's Questions
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Look at the top 8 cards of your deck. Choose as many Energy cards as you like, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

cards.name: Lost Remover
cards.text: Put 1 Special Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon in the Lost Zone.

cards.name: Lost World
cards.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.,Once during each player's turn, if that player's opponent has 6 or more Pokémon in the Lost Zone, the player may choose to win the game.

cards.name: Professor Elm's Training Method
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Professor Oak's New Theory
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.

cards.name: Research Record
cards.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and put as many of them as you like back on top of your deck in any order. Then, put the remaining cards on the bottom of your deck in any order.

cards.name: Sage's Training
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Look at the top 5 cards of your deck. Choose any 2 cards you find there and put them into your hand. Discard the other cards.

cards.name: Darkness Energy
cards.text: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this Effect if the Pokémon that Darkness Energy is attached to isn't Darkness. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Metal Energy
cards.text: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Deoxys
cards.text: DNA from a space virus mutated and became a Pokémon. It appears where auroras are seen.

attacks.name: Cell Storm
attacks.text: Discard 2 Psychic Energy attached to Deoxys and remove 6 damage counters from Deoxys.

cards.name: Dialga
cards.text: This Pokémon completely controls the flow of time. It uses its power to travel at will through the past and future.

attacks.name: Time Rewind
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck.

cards.name: Entei

abilities.name: Extreme Speed
abilities.text: Entei's Retreat Cost is Colorless Energy less for each Fire Energy attached to Entei.

cards.text: A Pokémon that races across the land. It is said that one is born every time a new volcano appears.

attacks.name: Wild Blaze
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

cards.name: Groudon
cards.text: Said to have expanded the lands by evaporating water with raging heat. It battled titanically with Kyogre.

attacks.name: Volcano Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard the top 4 cards of your opponent's deck. If tails, discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

cards.name: Ho-Oh
cards.text: Legends claim this Pokémon flies the world's skies continuously on its magnificent seven-colored wings.

attacks.name: Scorching Wing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Fire Energy attached to Ho-Oh.

cards.name: Kyogre
cards.text: A mythical Pokémon said to have swelled the seas with rain and tidal waves. It battled with Groudon.

attacks.name: Destructive Tsunami
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 40 damage to each of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Lugia
cards.text: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Palkia
cards.text: Its total control over the boundaries of space enable it to transport itself to faraway places or even other dimensions.

attacks.name: Wormhole
attacks.text: Switch Palkia with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Raikou

abilities.name: Extreme Speed
abilities.text: Raikou's Retreat Cost is Colorless less for each Lightning Energy attached to Raikou.

cards.text: A Pokémon that races across the land while barking a cry that sounds like crashing thunder.

attacks.name: Raging Thunder
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your Pokémon and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

cards.name: Rayquaza
cards.text: It flies in the ozone layer, way up high in the sky. Until recently, no one had ever seen it.

attacks.name: Inferno Spear
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy and a Lightning Energy attached to Rayquaza.

cards.name: Suicune

abilities.name: Extreme Speed
abilities.text: Suicune's Retreat Cost is Colorless less for each Water Energy attached to Suicune.

cards.text: This Pokémon races across the land. It is said that north winds will somehow blow whenever it appears.

attacks.name: Tsunami
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
